DOC.brief_summary: The present study aims to verify the analgesic potential of a new methodological proposal for application for transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS interactive) using patients with primary dysmenorrhoea and compare it with placebo in a randomized double blind study with convenience sample.
DOC.brief_title: Application of Electrical Neurostimulation Transcutaneous in Patients With Primary Dysmenorrhea.
DOC.detailed_description: The denouement will be the intensity of pain from visual analogue scale.
DOC.criteria: Primary dysmenorrhoea Moderate to severe pain Secondary dysmenorrhea Users of intrauterine device Cognitive impairment Failure to appear for treatment Pacemaker use Illicit drug use Epilepsy Skin problems Use of pain medication before the application of TENS
